title: Diabetes Management
text:
# Diabetes Management Guidelines ## Type 2 Diabetes Monitoring
Regular monitoring is essential for diabetes management:
- HbA1c every 3-6 months (target <7%)
- Annual eye exam (diabetic retinopathy screening)
- Annual foot exam for neuropathy
- Blood pressure monitoring (target <130/80)
- Lipid panel annually ## Medication Management
First-line therapy:
- Metformin 500mg twice daily
- Titrate to maximum tolerated dose
- Add SGLT2 inhibitors or GLP-1 agonists if needed ## Lifestyle Modifications
- Weight loss of 5-10% if overweight
- Regular physical activity (150 min/week)
- Carbohydrate counting education
- Blood glucose monitoring frequency based on medication ## Complication Prevention
Regular screening for:
- Nephropathy: urine microalbumin annually
- Retinopathy: dilated eye exam annually  
- Neuropathy: monofilament testing annually
- Cardiovascular disease: annual EKG if indicated

title: Medical Guidelines
text:
# Medical Guidelines for Chest Pain Assessment ## Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS)
Chest pain that worsens with exertion and improves with rest is highly suggestive of acute coronary syndrome. Key features include:
- Radiation to left arm, jaw, or back
- Associated symptoms: diaphoresis, nausea, vomiting
- Risk factors: age >65, diabetes, hypertension, smoking
- Immediate ECG and cardiac enzymes required ## Treatment Protocol
For suspected ACS:
1. Aspirin 325mg immediately
2. Nitroglycerin if systolic BP >100mmHg
3. Morphine for pain control
4. Beta-blockers if no contraindications
5. Consider PCI or thrombolytics based on presentation ## Risk Stratification
High risk features:
- ST elevation on ECG
- Elevated troponins
- Hemodynamic instability
- New onset heart failure ## Follow-up
All patients with chest pain should have:
- Cardiac stress testing within 72 hours
- Echocardiogram if indicated
- Lipid panel and HbA1c if diabetes
- Smoking cessation counseling
